That's a great approach! Incorporating fun and interactive elements, such as a scavenger hunt and team challenges, will definitely make the clean-up event more engaging and enjoyable for participants. Providing music and snacks will also help to keep everyone energized and motivated throughout the event.

Offering recognition and incentives, such as awards and prizes, is also a great way to encourage participants to take ownership of the event and make it a fun and memorable experience. It's a great way to acknowledge their hard work and dedication to the community.

Remember to also consider the environmental impact of the event and make sure to minimize waste and promote sustainability. You could also consider partnering with local organizations or businesses to amplify the impact of the event and provide more resources and support.

Here are some additional tips to make the event even more successful:

* Make sure to have a clear plan and schedule in place, including a timeline and a list of tasks and responsibilities.
* Assign a team leader or coordinator to oversee the event and ensure that everything runs smoothly.
* Provide clear instructions and guidelines for participants, including safety protocols and expectations.
* Encourage participants to share their experiences and photos on social media using a branded hashtag.
* Follow up with participants after the event to thank them for their participation and to gather feedback and suggestions for future events.

By following these tips and incorporating fun and interactive elements, you can make the clean-up event a fun and memorable experience for participants, while also promoting community engagement and environmental sustainability.
